Package backend.users

Class UserController

java.lang.Object
backend.users.UserController
@RestController public class UserController extends Object
user data focused rest controller for creating, managing, and logging in users and such

  • Method Details

    • createUser

      @PostMapping("/user/create") public User createUser(@RequestBody User user)
      mapping to creat a user
      Parameters:
      user - user object to create and add to user database
      Returns:
      null if user exists or user if it worked

    • manageUser

      @PutMapping("/user/manage") public User manageUser(@RequestBody User user)
      manage user mapping
      Parameters:
      user - updated user object, if fields are empty it is assumed that previous fields should be used
      Returns:
      updated user object

    • loginUser

      @PostMapping("/user/login") public User loginUser(@RequestBody User user)
      user login mapping
      Parameters:
      user - user object including username, authenticationData, and authenticationMethod
      Returns:
      user object from database

    • getOnlineUsers

      @GetMapping("/onlineUsers") public HashMap<Integer,User> getOnlineUsers()
      Returns:
      list of all online users from hashmap

    • logout

      @PostMapping("/user/logout") public User logout(@RequestBody User user)
      logout user
      Parameters:
      user - user id needed to logout
      Returns:
      user that was logged out or null if failed

    • getUserByName

      @GetMapping("/getUser/{user}") public User getUserByName(@PathVariable String user)
      get data about specific user
      Parameters:
      user - user object but only needs username defined to work right now
      Returns:
      user object including schedules and contact object

    • getUserById

      @GetMapping("/getUserById/{user}") public User getUserById(@PathVariable int user)
      get data about specific user
      Parameters:
      user - takes user id as int
      Returns:
      user object including schedules and contact object

    • getUserContactByName

      @GetMapping("/getUserContact/{user}") public UserContact getUserContactByName(@PathVariable String user)
      get contact data about specific user
      Parameters:
      user - user object but only needs username defined to work right now
      Returns:
      user contact object

    • getUserContactById

      @GetMapping("/getUserContactById/{user}") public UserContact getUserContactById(@PathVariable int user)
      get contact data about specific user
      Parameters:
      user - takes user id as int
      Returns:
      user contact object
